Detailed Description

The internal result of the parsing process.

A hierachical data structure based on adobe::forest. It represents the input formula string exactly. Because we don't want to introduce external dependencies to the Adobe Source Library, the result is converted to a flat empirical element list ( flatten() ). Alternative result types are possible too, of course, but not yet implemented.

void ElementGroup::addGroup ( const ElementGroup &  eg  )  [private]

Adds another element group.

It gets hierarchical here. Final layout: 

 [ <e1>  <e2>  <e3>  <g> ]         <= this element group
                      |
             [ <ee1> <ee2> <ee3> ] <= subGrp

 <e*[0-9]+> are regular elements
 <g> is a CompoundGroupElement with isGroup==true

Definition at line 87 of file elementgroup.cpp.

References mF.

Referenced by addSubgroup().

void ElementGroup::addSubgroup ( const ElementGroup &  subGrp,
size_t  strIdx 
)

Adds another element group.

Some parsing related decisions are made here regarding nucleon numbers, respectively isotopes which are distinct element groups formally.

See also:
addGroup

void ElementGroup::addToken ( ParserState &  s  ) 

Adds the current Token data to this element group.

Eventually, creates a new CompoundElement from it or adds its data to the previous element.
